passage_text: 1 For details see, How Much Does a Tile Floor Cost. 2  Retiling around a bathtub or inside a shower enclosure can cost $800-$2,500 or more, depending on the type of tiles, total square footage, the amount of repairs needed, any special pattern or border, and local labor rates. 1 Total costs (materials and labor) for professional installation of a bathroom tile floor averages $10-$40 a square foot, but it can cost more for custom tiles, detailed patterns or unusual room layouts.

The cost of materials for retiling inside the shower enclosure or a bathtub at the time of publication can cost between $50 to more than $1,500 if you're doing it yourself. Hiring a professional to retile inside a shower enclosure or a bathtub can cost around $800 to more than $2,500. The average costs to hire a professional to retile a bathroom floor including materials and labor is about $10 to $40 a square foot. Removing existing tile can cost an additional $200 to more than $800 and repairing any damages underneath the old tiles can cost anywhere between $1,000 to more than $5,000.

Additional Materials Needed. In addition to new tile, you will also need tile adhesive or mortar, grout, grout sealer, buckets, spreaders, rags, a level, gloves, goggles and a tile cutter or saw. The cost of supplies will average at least $100 in addition to the cost of a tile cutter which costs $100 on up. So on the low end for a 10-by-10 bathroom floor, expect to pay at least $300 for removing old tile and at least $500 to $1,700 for installing new tile.

1 Depending on the tile selected, do-it-yourself tiling of the floor of a typical bathroom can cost $100-$1,500 or more. 2  The tile alone can be $1-$40 or more a square foot; replacing backer board adds about $2 a square foot; and do-it-yourself tools and other material can be $60-$200 or more. 1 Total costs (materials and labor) for professional installation of a bathroom tile floor averages $10-$40 a square foot, but it can cost more for custom tiles, detailed patterns or unusual room layouts.

Retiling the Floor. At the time of publication retiling a bathroom floor yourself can cost between $100 to more than $1,500. The cost of tiles range from $1 to up to $40 or more a square foot and tools and other material can cost you from $60 to more than $200. The average costs to hire a professional to retile a bathroom floor including materials and labor is about $10 to $40 a square foot. Removing existing tile can cost an additional $200 to more than $800 and repairing any damages underneath the old tiles can cost anywhere between $1,000 to more than $5,000.

As of January 2014, the cost for removing tile averages $3 to $5 per square foot while the cost for professional installation of new tile can range from $5 to $17 per square foot -- depending on the tile material chosen and size of the bathroom. So on the low end for a 10-by-10 bathroom floor, expect to pay at least $300 for removing old tile and at least $500 to $1,700 for installing new tile.

For example, a 10-by-10 bathroom would need 100 square feet of tile; choosing laminate tile at $1 per square foot would cost $100 while selecting porcelain tile at $2.50 per square foot would cost $250. Look for sale, clearance or close-out pricing to get the best deal. So on the low end for a 10-by-10 bathroom floor, expect to pay at least $300 for removing old tile and at least $500 to $1,700 for installing new tile.
